required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Vitamin D3 - Omega3 - Home Exercise - HeALTHy Aging and Longevity Cohort
clinical_study.official_title: Vitamin D3 - Omega3 - Home Exercise - HeALTHy Aging and Longevity Cohort

brief_summary.textblock: The DO-HEALTH trial will be extended into the cohort including the collection on life style factors such as diet, quality of life and physical activity, as well as health-related data on co-morbid conditions as well as a standardized assessment of multiple organ functions, physical, cognitive and mental function using surveys and standardized health assessments.

detailed_description.textblock:
The DO-HEALTH cohort will be a continuation of the trial without intervention and will elucidate longterm determinants of healthy, active and independent aging in European community-dwelling older adults. The main emphasize of the cohort will be to determine the risk factors, to quantify the incidence and to describe the trajectories of incident frailty, impaired mobility, loss of independence and age related morbidity (e.g. heart arrhythmia, type 2 diabetes, falls, fractures).
Additionally, the cohort will continue to investigate the primary endpoints of the original trial like the risk and incidence of injurious falls (bone); functional decline (muscle); high blood pressure (cardiovascular); cognitive decline (brain); and the rate of any infection (immunity). Moreover, the cohort will include and extend key secondary and exploratory endpoints of the original trial such as incidence and prevalence of anemia, sarcopenia, cardiovascular diseases, type 2 diabetes and cancer.

primary_outcome.description: assessed by short physical performance test battery
assessed by fall questionnaire at each visit
Standardized blood pressure assessment in sitting position
assessed by infection questionnaire at each visit

secondary_outcome.measure: Incidence and prevalence of frailty
secondary_outcome.description: based on criteria by L. Fried (shrinking, weakness, poor endurance and energy, slowness, low physical activity level), SHARE-FI

secondary_outcome.measure: Incidence and prevalence of impaired mobility
secondary_outcome.description: assessed by EQ5D-3L, physical activity questionnaire

secondary_outcome.measure: Incidence and prevalence of functional dependency
Incidence and prevalence of anemia or iron deficiency
secondary_outcome.description: assessed by blood markers (ferritin, soluble transferrin receptor, RBC, Hb, erythrocyte indices (MCV, MCH, MCHC), reticulocytes)

secondary_outcome.measure: Incidence and prevalence of any cardiovascular disease
Incidence and prevalence of heart arrhythmia
Incidence and prevalence of atrial fibrillation
Incidence and prevalence of heart failure, cardiomyopathy, heart valves abnormalities
secondary_outcome.description: assessed by medical history, ECG, physical examination

secondary_outcome.measure: Incidence of stroke
Incidence and prevalence of Type 2 diabetes
Incidence and prevalence of dementia
Incidence and prevalence of osteoarthritis
Incidence and prevalence osteoporosis
Incidence and prevalence of sarcopenia, osteosarcopenia
Incidence and prevalence of any gastrointestinal disease
Incidence and prevalence of gastroesophageal reflux disease (GERD)
Incidence and prevalence of any micronutrient deficiency (Vitamins, Minerals and fatty acids)
Incidence and prevalence of knee buckling
secondary_outcome.description: assessed by medical history, Buckling, KOOS, HOOS

secondary_outcome.measure: Incidence and prevalence of chronic pain
secondary_outcome.description: assessed by medical history, McGill, Joint Map, EQ5D-3L

secondary_outcome.measure: Incidence and prevalence of subjective memory complaints
secondary_outcome.description: assessed by medical history, MoCA, MACQ

secondary_outcome.measure: Incidence and prevalence of hearing impairment
secondary_outcome.description: assessed by medical history, hearing test, physical examination

secondary_outcome.measure: Incidence and prevalence of depression
Incidence and prevalence insomnia
Incidence and prevalence of chronic inflammation
secondary_outcome.description: assessed by medical history, blood marker (e.g. CRP)

secondary_outcome.measure: Incidence and prevalence of polypharmacy
Incidence and prevalence of inappropriate medication prescription
Incidence and prevalence of age related morbidity by individual drug use (e.g. Proton-Pump-Inhibitors, anticoagulants, benzodiazepines, antibiotics)
Incidence and prevalence of malnutrition
secondary_outcome.description: assessed by medical history, FFQ, GOHAI, Rome

secondary_outcome.measure: Incidence and prevalence of urinary incontinence
secondary_outcome.description: assessed by medical history, IPPS, QUID

secondary_outcome.measure: Incidence and prevalence of impaired quality of life
Incidence and prevalence of functional decline
Incidence of fractures
Incidence of all-cause hospitalization
Incidence, prevalence and trajectories of frequent health care utilization
Incidence of nursing home placement
Incidence of cancer (any cancer, gastro-intestinal, breast cancer in women, prostate cancer in men)
Incidence of all-cause mortality

study_pop.textblock: The DO-HEALTH Cohort includes the population of the former DO-HEALTH clinical trial (NCT01745263)

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Former participation in the DO-HEALTH clinical trial study
Exclusion Criteria:
- Inability or unwillingness to give written informed consent
- Medical condition that would make the results of the tests/assessments unreliable and/or would put too much burden to the participant, and/or leads to safety concerns.

overall_official.last_name: Heike Bischoff-Ferrari, Prof. Dr. med. DrPH

facility.name: Centre on Aging and Mobility, University of Zurich, City Hospital Zurich
